creditline: Gift of John R. Van Derlip
medium: Black and white chalk, with touches of red chalk, and pen and brown ink with wash on light brown paper
signed: in black chalk, LL: [D.W. 5 August 1837]; in pen and brown ink, LL: [D.W. 5 Agst 1837]
text: Among this series of hand studies, the Scottish artist David Wilkie included a carefully described portrait drawing of an older woman. With rather spare chalk and pen lines, Wilkie achieved an impressive lifelike quality in the figure.
title: Head of a Woman and Study of Hands
